About National Institute of Technology Agartala The Government of India converted the Tripura Engineering College to National Institute of Technology Agartala on 1st April 2006 vide notification No. F. 20-20/2004/TS III/ dated 10.03.2006 of the Ministry of Human Resources Development (MHRD), Govt. of India. During the conversion, Tripura Engineering College was offering undergraduate degrees in Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication and Production Engineering.

Director’s Message The National Institute of Technology Agartala(NITA),an Institute of National Importance (INI) was instituted by Government of India with the mission to herald excellence in technical education and research in the North-East region. The institute was established by the Ministry of Education (MoE) in the era of renaissance in technical education in north east. PROF. S. K. PATRA Director, NIT Agartala

Notice Board Notice for Branch Change for academic session 2025-26. Notification regarding National Space Day Celebration on 23rd August 2025 in NIT Agartala. Notification regarding Anti-Ragging Duty Roster 2025 of faculty members for NIT Agartala Hostels. "All the Results published in the session of Supply (Summer) 2025 are published. Students can check the results from their respective MIS Accounts". Notice regarding online registration process for physical reporting for UG & Dual Degree student, through JoSAA-2025. Status of candidates who have submitted grievances for the post of Deputy Registrar, NIT Agartala. "Physical Reporting of candidates, seat allotted to NIT Agartala through CCMT/ CCMN 2025 for M.Tech / M.Sc. programmes is extended, up to 14th August 2025. Student Reporting time- (09 am to 02 pm)." Notice regarding bus timing of 01(One) Staff Bus from NIT Agartala to Agartala City. Notice regarding 79th Independence Day on 15th August in NIT Agartala Campus. Walk-In-Interview for the post of  Guest Faculty (Physics) at NIT Agartala.

Life on Campus Our Students The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

Students Our Departments There are 9 (nine) branches in B. Tech. Level, 23 (twenty three) specializations in Engineering at Master’s Level and 4 branches in Dual Degree Level. The institute also offers MBA, MCA, M. Sc. and Doctoral Programs. The institute is also equipped with high-end laboratories that ensure an opportunity for the students to work independently.

Student’s Corner The Institute has Boys and Girls to accommodate in 4 Boys’ Hostels and 1 Girls’ Hostel. The Medical Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and other supporting staffs are available in the campus for rendering medical care. NIT Agartala has NCC unit for Boys and Girls. The NITA Student Gymkhana is an active student body that acts as a liaison between the students and the administration. The Gymkhana promotes the objectives of fostering extracurricular and co-curricular activities and welfare of the students. The students of NIT Agartala are also participated in the national level Technical Fest organized by different IITs and NITs. They are also actively engaged in different technical and cultural clubs. Training & Placement Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

About CRF-NIT, Agartala:-

The concept of Central Research Facility (CRF) is an integrated establishment to carry out research activities centrally under an umbrella. A CRF is of utmost importance in any academic institution where state-of-the-art analytical and high-end instruments are housed at a single location manned by qualified personnel to provide scientific and technical services for supporting research, carried out by UG, PG, PhD and project students. Such a facility represents a key commitment for preserving and raising the efficiency of research to top international standards. It strengthens the research-relevant infrastructure of Science and Technology.

At NIT Agartala, to begin with, CRF has been developed with various sophisticated equipment and instruments, mainly:

X-ray Diffractometer (XRD)

Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM)

Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM)

Liquid Nitrogen Plant (LNP)

Atomic Force Microscope (AFM)

All equipment and instruments under CRF will be used for various types of characterization including study of structure and chemical composition of surfaces and bulk materials at different length scales (sub-nanometer to millimeter), phase transitions, as well as evaluation of mechanical, electrical, magnetic, and optical properties. Liquid Nitrogen Plant (LNP) will help to produce Nitrogen in liquid form which can be utilized for developing low temperature research facility in the areas of Bio-Engineering, Chemistry and Medical Science.

Objectives of the CRF:-

Our objective is to extend the present research facilities to fulfill the following objectives:

to carry out analysis of samples received from the scientists/institutes;

to provide facilities of sophisticated analytical instruments to scientists and other users from academic institutes, R&D laboratories and industries to enable them to carry out measurements for R&D work;

to organize short term courses/workshops on the use and application of various instruments and analytical techniques;

to train technicians for maintenance and operation of sophisticated instruments; and

to carry out more effective and result oriented research of international level in the field of Science & Technology.

Users of the Facilities: -

All researchers from Academic Institutions and Industries.

Requisition Process:

1) Fill the downloaded application form as per your requirement.

2) Pay the requisite amount of fee in advance.

3) Sent your application form along with samples including proof of payment to the following address by post.

To

The Chairman

NIT Agartala, Barjala

Jirania, West Tripura, Pin: 799046

(Superscribe on the Envelop “Requisition for using of ……………….(Name of Instrument) under CRF, NITA”)

4) Your requisition will be booked and acknowledge for the same.

Alternately, user can sent a scan copy of the application form followed by the above steps to chairmancrfnitagartala@gmail.com other than NITA applicant.

NOTE:

INCOMPLETE APPLICATION WILL SUMMARILY BE REJECTED AND NO CORRESPONDENCE WILL BE ENTERTAINED FOR THE SAME.

Bio Engineering

Programmes Program Outcomes (POs): The students who have undergone the B.Tech. program in Bioengineering: Will have an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science and basic engineering techniques in biological systems and will have comprehensive understanding of the working mechanisms of the biological systems and about the recent advancements in the field. Will have an ability to analyze problems involving biological systems by using the principles of science, engineering and mathematics. Will be able to provide solutions to the problems involving bioengineering by designing and conducting experiments, interpreting and analyzing data to find out trends. Will have the knowledge and exposure on different laboratory techniques to analyze the biological systems, about different biomedical/process equipment and will have exposure to computational tools and approaches to solve problem involving biological systems. Will gain expertise in handling modern equipment as well as computational tools which can be used in prediction and analysis of complex problems in bioengineering. Will be able to apply knowledge acquired to assess health-related, legal and cultural issues and to serve the cause of medical sectors in the society. Will be equipped with techniques to tackle pollution and will help achieving sustainable development. Will learn about ethical issues related to developments biological sciences and bioengineering and will apply professional ethics in engineering practices. will be able to function as a part of a team and individual, as the situation demands, to handles diverse problems in multi-disciplinary settings. Will be able to communicate efficiently about the engineering problems related to bioengineering to the larger society with the aid of effective reports, documentation and presentation. Will be able to utilize the knowledge of engineering and management principles to manage projects in multi-disciplinary set-up. Will have the necessary impetus for life-long learning in the context of technological changes.

PEOs (Program Educational Objectives): The major objectives of the B.Tech. program in Bioengineering are: To impart knowledge about applications of engineering techniques in biological systems. To attain knowledge and expertise to work efficiently in biotechnological, biochemical and biomedical industries . To prepare students to pursue higher studies in bioengineering . To develop capabilities to work in research and development organizations. PSOs (Program Specific Objectives): To learn protocols and employ engineering principles to solve the problems relevant to today’s industries in the field of bioengineering. To learn to design and develop different equipment, experiments and computational approaches related to bioengineering.

Programmes : The department currently offers the following programs: Under Graduate Program (B.Tech) in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering for 4 Years Post Graduate Program (M.Tech) in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering for 2 Years PhD in Bio Engineering Curriculum & Syllabus : Syllabus for "M.Tech in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering" Curriculum and Syllabus for "B.Tech in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering"

Mathematics

programmes

DST FIST Sponsored Department (Sanctioned amount: 50 Lakhs)

i. Outline About the Department

The Department of Mathematics starts along with the inception of NIT

Agartala in 2006 with the up gradation of erstwhile Tripura Engineering

College (TEC).TEC had been a revered Institute in the field of

Engineering and Technology since its inceptions in 1965. The Institute

(TEC &NIT Agartala) has already completed its glorious fifty years

of its journey, in 2014. The Department of Mathematics is motivated

towards excellence in research and teaching and has accomplished in this

venture continuously over the time to a large extent. Initially, the

department catered the need of teaching Engineering Mathematics to the

undergraduate students. In 2010 the Department made a big stride in the

way of starting its M.Sc. in Mathematics program. Further expansion of

the Department in the form of opening BSMS, a 5 years dual degree course

in 2014 was really a milestone in the history of the Department. Since

then, it started functioning as a full-fledged department in true sense.

At present, the Department is offering M.Sc course in Mathematics and

Computing; BSMS (5 years dual degree course) in Mathematics and BSMS (5

years dual degree course) in Mathematics and Computing; Ph.D. Programs

in Mathematics (Pure & Applied) apart from helping the Engineering

and Management Departments in the way of offering Engineering

Mathematics, Operations Research(OR), Numerical Analysis to under

graduate and post graduate engineering students.

About the Faculty Members

The Department has highly qualified faculty members consisting of one

(1) Professor, four (4) Associate Professors, ten (10) Assistant

Professors, one (1) Teaching Assistant and one (1) Lab Assistant. In

their pursuit of research the faculty members are doing an extensive

study in  vast and diverse fields relating to Topological Space,

Nature-inspired Optimization Techniques, Inventory management

(Operations Research), De-Novo Programming Problem, Multi-Criteria

Decision-Making, Fuzzy Control System, Computational Fluid Dynamics,

Biomathematics, Graph theory, ODE & PDE , Super-symmetric Quantum

Mechanics, Water Wave Mechanics, Heat Transfer, Convection, Numerical

Methods, Neural Network, Wireless Network, Image Processing etc.

A Brief Insight

Energetic, highly motivated and academically sound young faculties and research scholars.

Dynamic involvement in academic and administrative tasks.

Contributing towards research on contemporary subject areas.

Authored books, book chapters and published their research works as patents.

Very frequently all faculties of our Department visit various

venerated  universities/Institutes in India and abroad in order to

present their research papers in conferences and to attend in Workshops ,

Schools and for doing collaborative research works.

In academic year 2019-20 total 96(approx) research papers have been published in reputed national and

international peer-reviewed journals with high impact factor.

About the Courses

Admission in the two years (4 Semester) M.Sc Degree Course is made

through merit basis with an initial intake capacity of 10 students.

Syllabus revision workshop was organized by the Department, for

up-gradation of UG-syllabus and course structure / syllabus for M.Sc.

program to make a significant contribution to academia and research

& development in Mathematics.

The Department offers two years (4 Semester) PG course, viz. M.Sc in

Mathematics and Computing with an initial intake capacity of 13

students. A syllabus revision workshop was organized by the Department,

for up-gradation of syllabus for this PG level program.

The Department also offers a 10 semester BS-MS Dual Degree Program in

Mathematics and Computing with initial intake capacity of 25 students.

This Dual Degree Program encourages and persuades the students to

grasp in-depth knowledge and also widens their career opportunities. On

completion of higher degree from this institute, a few of students

qualify for

some competitive exams  like NET, GATE, SET, TOEFL, GRE etc. in every

year for which our faculty members devote themselves in imparting

special coaching to students who aspire to qualify the exams. Some

fellows join Ph.D. career as full time researchers at reputed

universities or Institutes in India and abroad.

The Department offers collaborative and interdisciplinary Ph.D. programs

in Mathematics admitting both full time and part time research

scholars.

Under Graduate Programmes

B.Tech in Electrical Engineering (4 Years):

This course aims at providing all the facilities

for producing technocrats with sound knowledge in all the subjects such as

electrical machines, power systems, instrumentation etc. including the elective

papers with a strong background of practical knowledge relevant to the theory

papers. Graduates coming out will be able to orient themselves to take up any

challenging jobs in the industry and also will be able to carry out research

and developmental activities with innovative ideas. The students are assigned

with a major project during the end semesters where they carry out the

developmental work under the guidance /supervision of the staffs.

Program Educational Objectives (PEOs)

PEO-1: To empower

students to identify, formulate and solve Mechanical Engineering

problems  by applying their knowledge in the field of Mathematics,

Science, Communication and Computing skills and enabling them to

understand specific problem areas and finding the optimum solutions for

the same.

PEO-2: To widen the talents of the students to become effective

collaborators and innovators, leading in efforts to tackle social,

business, design and production challenges.

PEO-3: To develop industry focused skills and leadership qualities to become successful engineers and entrepreneurs.

PEO-4: To enable students to acquire skills to communicate

effectively with the society and the constituents which enable them to

collaborate as team members and team leaders.

PEO-5: To instill professional work ethics and social responsibilities.

PEO-6: To encourage the students for developing life-long learning

attitude with moral ethics and values and professional development

through higher study, continuing education and Independent research

activities.

Program Specific Outcome (PSOs)

PSO 1: Specification, fabrication, testing, operation or documentation of basic mechanical systems/processes.

Chemical Engineering

programmes

With that

mission, the department started to offer BTech in Chemical Engineering degree

in the undergraduate level since 2009-10 and presently has an intake capacity

of 75 students. BTech is national JEE mains exams. In the postgraduate level,

the department is offering MTech in Chemical Engineering with intake capacity

of 10 seats since 2012-13. MTech positions are filled up both through GATE and

Non-GATE entrances. The department is also offering PhD in Engineering program

since 2012-13. The Ph.D. positions are filled-up twice a year through

advertisement and open completion.

The BTech

curriculum has 160 credits spanning over 4 years including 43 credits common

engineering curriculum in 1

st

year, 41.5 credits in 2

nd

year, 45 credits in 3

rd

year and 31.5 credits in 4

th

and

final year with options to undertake 6 months’ project in the industry in the

final semester of the BTech program.

The MTech

curriculum has 80 credits spanning over 2 years including 50 credit in 1

st

year, 30 credits in 2

nd

year, with options to undertake full 1 year

(2 semester) research in the final year of the MTech program

For the purpose

of delivering quality education to the students and keep upto changing global

and industrial demand, the department revises the curriculum from time to time

with input from industry and academia. The faculty members are involved in

teaching and advising students and make their academic journey memorable.

PROGRAM EDUCATION OBJECTIVES (PEOs)

PEO1-To impart the adequate fundamental knowledge in the chemical engineering domain.

PEO2- Application of chemical engineering knowledge in design, research, innovation, industrial practices and societal development.

PEO3- To impart adequate knowledge for the product development utilizing the available resources in the North-east part of the India.

PEO4- To enhance the skill of problem solving and employability, time and trace management, engagement in team work.

PROGRAM SPECIFIC OUTCOMES (PSOs)

PSO1- The graduated students will be employable to chemical and other allied industries by acquiring the knowledge to identify, analyze, control and solve the industrial, environmental and management problems.

PSO2-The students will be able to carry forward higher studies and research on multi-disciplinary fields.

PSO3-The students will be able to design chemical equipments, plants; development of products and also to carry out entrepreneurship.

facility

The department

has state-of the-art laboratories for teaching and research to cater emerging

research challenges. With the purpose of providing excellent learning and

research experience the department has developed elaborate laboratory

facilities. Facilities and infrastructure are added and revamped every year.

Departmental Library:

In addition to Central library of the institute, the library of the department has

broad and eclectic collection of books, research articles covers different

aspects of chemical engineering to assist the students in order to enrich their

knowledge and ideas. Presently library owns several text books, reference

books, research articles as hard and soft copy.

Chemical Engineering

research

has diverse research dimensions in various Chemical engineering domains which

include fluid dynamics, numerical simulation, catalysis and reaction

engineering, environmental engineering, biofuel, bioenergy, renewable energy,

sustainable engineering, energy and fuel technology, materials engineering,

nanotechnology, and polymer technology, as well as many other emerging and

pressing areas of chemical engineering.

Computer Science and Engineering

programmes The Department of Computer Science and Engineering of National Institute of Technology Agartala offers undergraduate and postgraduate programme  where students are encouraged to acquire knowledge with an integrated thinking about education, research & development, application and training. The students are provided knowledge to understand the fundamental of basic sciences and humanities, inter disciplinary knowledge, innovation, creative problem solving abilities, intellectual honesty and professional ethics, capacity for team work in inter disciplinary, national and international environment.  Since its inception in 1999, the department has always been recognized for excellence. The first undergraduate batch rolled out in the year 2003. MBA

Master in Business Administration (MBA)

About the Programme

This programme is aimed at providing in–depth understanding to students in technical, human and conceptual skills necessary for a successful manager with specialization in different functional areas like Financial Management, Marketing Management, Human Resource and System Management. The teaching strategy for this programme oriented towards the application of knowledge with live cases and teaching aids. There is a six weeks summer internship programme for students, after completion of first year course to develop business acumen. The student has regular interactions with personalities from various Industries/ Academia and also undergoes frequent Industrial visits.

MBA Admission Process

Eligibility Criteria

:

Graduates of full time regular course in Engineering discipline with 60% of marks (CGPA/CPI of 6.0 in 10 point scale] and for any other disciplines with 55% of marks [CGPA/CPI of 5.5 in 10 point scale] with a valid CAT/CMAT/GMAT/MAT/Institute level test score. A relaxation of 5% or 0.5 in CGPA/CPI in a 10 point scale on graduation marks maybe extended to the SC/ST candidate.

Final year appearing candidates may also apply.

A valid GMAT score will be applicable for foreign students only

.

Students appearing at their final year graduation examination may also apply

(with eligibility criteria up to last completed semester) Such candidates, if selected, will be admitted provisionally and candidates have to submit certificate of completion of the graduation degree. If they are not able to fulfill the eligibility criteria or unable to submit certificate of completion of the graduation degree, their admission will be stand cancelled.

Application Fee (Non-refundable):

Rs. 1000/- for OP/OBC candidates and Rs. 500 for SC and ST candidates

Selection Process:

The steps involved in MBA Admission are as follows Step 1: Screening of applications on the basis of performance in entrance (CAT/CMAT/GMAT/MAT examination/ Institute Level Test) Step 2: Performance in Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI) Step 3: Profile of the Candidate

Programme Education Objectives:

The Programme has following education objectives:

Programme Objective- I:

Integrate functional areas of business knowledge across disciplines and synthesize functional business knowledge within strategic organizational framework.

Programme Objective- II:

Illustrate ability to apply critical thinking and ethical decision making to complex business problems and exhibit competence in applying interpersonal and managerial skills within an institutional context.

Programme Objective- III:

Demonstrate ability to motivate others to achieve strategic outcomes and create an orientation of personal responsibility, respect and professionalism.

Programme Outcomes:

The Programme has following education objectives:

a) Use systems thinking to describe how core concepts in each functional area relate to and are integrated across disciplines.

b) Identify appropriate processes for making organizational decisions.

c) Demonstrate ability to bring disparate functional areas of business to bear on the formulation of organizational strategy.

d) Identify and describe core concepts in the key functional areas of business.

e) Recognize and explain appropriate analytical methods for solving discipline--- specific business issues.

f) Construct a reasoned critique of an organizational decision.

g) Apply critical thinking skills in making an organizational decision.

h) Relate relevant ethical frameworks to the resolution of a business dilemma.

i) Display proficiency in building a persuasive case.

j) Show ability to manage organizational constituencies.

Management, Humanities & Social Sciences

PhD Ph.D. Programme The Department offers Ph.D programme (Full Time / Part Time / Self Sponsored) in Humanities & Social Sciences and Management . The admission to the Ph.D programme is conducted twice (as it is notified time to time basis) every year usually in the month of December/June. • Eligibility criteria for admission to Ph.D Programme in Humanities & Social Sciences : Scholars for admission to the Ph.D. program in Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS) must have a Master degree in relevant discipline with a minimum of 60% marks or equivalent or 6.5 CGPA in a 10 point grading system or 55% (6.0 CGPA out of 10) with a UGC/CSIR-NET/NBHM tenable for the year of admission. Preference will be given to NET qualified candidates. • Eligibility criteria for admission to Ph.D Programme in Management MBA/P.G. Diploma in Management of 2-year duration with 60% marks (or a CGPA of 6.5 in 10 point scale). Preference will be given to GATE and NET qualified candidates.

About

The Government of India converted the Tripura Engineering College to National Institute

of Technology Agartala on 1st April 2006 vide notification No. F. 20-20/2004/TS III/ dated

10.03.2006 of the Ministry of Human Resources Development (MHRD), Govt. of India. During

the conversion, Tripura Engineering College was offering undergraduate degrees in Civil,

Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication and Production Engineering.

Director’s Message

The National Institute of Technology Agartala(NITA),an Institute of National Importance (INI) was instituted by Government of India with the mission to herald excellence in technical education and research in the North-East region.

The institute was established by the Ministry of Education (MoE) in the era of renaissance in technical education in north east.

Life on Campus

Our Students

The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the

National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got

direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

Students

Our Departments

There are 9 (nine) branches in B. Tech. Level, 23 (twenty three) specializations in Engineering at Master’s Level and 4

branches in Dual Degree Level. The institute also offers MBA, MCA, M. Sc. and Doctoral Programs. The institute is also equipped with high-end laboratories

that ensure an opportunity for the students to work independently.

Student’s Corner

The Institute has Boys and Girls to accommodate in 4 Boys’ Hostels and 1 Girls’ Hostel.

The Medical Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and other supporting staffs are available in the campus for

rendering medical care.

NIT Agartala has NCC unit for Boys and Girls.

The NITA Student Gymkhana is an active student body that acts as a liaison between the students and the administration. The Gymkhana promotes

the objectives of fostering extracurricular and co-curricular activities and welfare of the students.

The students of NIT Agartala are also participated in the national level Technical Fest organized by different IITs and NITs. They are also actively

engaged in different technical and cultural clubs.

Training & Placement

Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

Our Students

IThe word student is etymologically derived through Middle English from the Latin second-type conjugation verb studere, meaning "to direct one's zeal at"; hence a student could be described as "one who directs zeal at a subject". In its widest use, student is used for anyone who is learning.

Even being in the remote Norh Eastern part of India, the students of NIT Agartala are not lagging behind in any of the activities.The students take active part in all sorts of activities held in cultural fests, in or outside the campus. The history of the college speaks of the students of NIT Agartala, their achievements in various events relating to science and technology and thier success in competitions being organized in various elite institues from various parts of thee country. The senior students feel their responsibility to help the junior students. It is very much true that the students and the faculty members help an institution to reach their persuing goal. This environment can be found in reality in this college. Needless to say, the effective and high quality feedback has been identified as a key element of quality teaching, and such arguments are well supported by the findings of meta-analysed studies that faculty members have coupled from their experiences and expertises with research on teams to create a number of resources that hopefully will help faculty members increase the effectiveness of students in their courses.

Computing & ICT Unit

The Computing & ICT Unit of NIT Agartala manages the network services, website and other domain related activity in the Institute.

Some major tasks being looked after by the Computing & ICT Unit are:

Providing the internet services to the Institute.

Providing the institute email services for employees and research students of the Institute.

Hosting and managing the Institute website.

Running all useful and essential services like naming services, DHCP services, firewall, web application services, etc to the institute for different purposes.

Providing the facility of Net based installation of major operating systems and other software to the Institute.

Providing the support to the technical team of the companies visiting for campus placement of students.

About NITA

About NITA

Facilities

Virtual Tour of NIT Agartala

Strategic Plan 2020-2030

Our Vision

Institute is committed to develop highly competent young Engineers, Scientists, and Management Professionals to cater to the ever increasing techno-managerial needs of national and international standards fulfilling professional ethics and societal commitment.

Our Mission

To produce techno-managerial human resource in line with global need offering state-of-the-art facility, research and training in engineering and allied disciplines.

To enhance the effectiveness of technical education with innovative system and devising a mechanism to facilitate application of research findings to solve real problems of industries/academics.

To nurture and sustain an academic ambience conducive to the development of intellectually capable and committed professionals so that an effective growth is obtained for the economic development of the region and the nation as a whole.

To establish as the corridor of higher education for the South East Asian countries.

Our Objective

In order to response effectively to the needs of the society, the Institute aims at

Influencing the technical practices of the Governmental and Non-Governmental organizations through its Under Graduate and Post Graduate teaching programme for the young and prospective technocrats, Training of corporate executives, Consultancy and Research. The research programmes are oriented towards developing technical systems that are most suitable in the Indian context particularly for North-Eastern Zone.

Transpiring the technical knowledge from the Institute level to the entrepreneurs, so that an effective growth is obtained for the economic development of the Region and the Nation as a whole.

Enhance the effectiveness of technical education and innovative system and devising a mechanism to facilitate application of research findings to solve the problems in the industry.

Our Education System

Presently the Institute offers eight UG courses and PG courses in several fields along with Post Doctoral Fellowships. This Institute is autonomous under NIT being act passed by the parliament.

The Institute recently introduced a new curriculum in the line of IITs where more number of elective subjects are being offered to make the system flexible. Previously, the Institute used to follow the mark based system of evaluation, but have been switching over to credit based system in order to keep track with the global evaluation methods. Industrial training, Undertaking projects are parts of the education system and students are also encouraged to take various activities for social development through NSS and NCC.

Facilities

The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

The Institute has all basic

infrastructural facilities. It has got adequate number of well qualified and experienced

faculty members and technical & supporting staff. This is a part the

Institute has the following facilities:-

Ø

Centralized Library (Knowledge Centre),

Ø

Computer Laboratory (Department-wise)

Ø

Workshops

Ø

Upgraded Laboratories with the latest equipments.

Ø

Campus Internet (Local Area Network and Wi-Fi)

Hostel Facilities:

The Institute has both Boys’ hostel and

Girls’ hostel facilities. Presently there are 5(five) Boys’ hostels with a

total intake capacity of 3000 and Girls’ hostels having intake capacity of 500.

Medical Care:

The Medical

Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and

other supporting staffs are available in the campus for rendering medical care

to the students, staff and other inmates in the campus. In case of emergency,

arrangements are made for shifting the patients to the Jirania Rural Hospital

(Primary Health Centre) which is 4km away from the campus. In case of grave

necessity, the patients are also taken to the State Hospital at Agartala.

Banks and Post Office

:  The

State Bank of India and Canara Bank has a branch with ATM facilities operating

from the Institute campus. Apart from this, the Punjab & Sindh Bank has

also an ATM facility in the Institute premises. The Tripura Gramin Bank runs

one branch in the Institute Complex. There is a Sub-Post Office in the name of

‘‘NIT, Agartala’’ in the Institute campus and its PIN Code is 799046.

Extra-Curricular

Activities

:  The students actively

participate in all co-curricular activities like games and sports, techno-cultural

festival, essay competition, drama competition, rallies on various themes, NSS

programmes etc. sponsored by the State Government, Central Government and other

statutory bodies and the Institute authority. N.S.S or N.C.C. is a compulsory

subject for all students of first year.

Center for Career Development (CCD)

Center for Career Development

Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

Space Technology Incubation Centre (S-TIC)

The

(S-TIC) at NIT Agartala

was

established on September 18, 2018, on the ground floor of the CSE building

(Room No. G-14), covering an area of 1600 sq. ft. The inauguration was held

remotely through online mode from the Hotel Leela Palace of Bengaluru by the

joint connotation of Prof. Harish Kumar Sharma, the then Director of NIT

Agartala and Dr K. Sivan, the then Secretary of the Department of Space and

Chairman of ISRO. This event had been glorified by the gracious presence of Sri

Biplab Kumar Deb the then Hon’ble Chief Minister of Govt. of Tripura.

This is

the first-ever Incubation Centre of the Indian Space Research Organization

(ISRO) throughout the India.

The ISRO

is desirous of setting up this Centre to attract and nurture the young academia

with innovative ideas / research aptitude for carrying out research and

developing the Academia-Industry ecosystem.

A total

of 10 Technology Development Projects (TDPs) were approved and sanctioned under

this Centre, among few are ready for a new start with active participation from

various Institutes of North-Eastern region.Various papers have been presented and

published/communicated in various International Journals and Conferences under

these Technology Development Projects.

I am

delighted to inform you that out of 10 (ten) approved & sanctioned incubation

projects under this Centre, 06 (six) are successfully completed.

As an

outcome of these completed projects, one Technology Transfer has been done by“Product Handover” to the Indian Space

Research Organization (ISRO), Department of Space, Government of India on April

27th, 2023.

This product has also been invited and showcased

in the “National Technology Week event” happened from 11th to 14th

May 2023 at Pragati Maidan of New Delhi. This event has been inaugurated and

circumambulated by the honorable Prime Minister of India Sri Narendra

Damodardas Modi.

Sports at NIT-Agartala

NIT Agartala is

renowned for its dynamic sports culture that emphasizes physical fitness,

sportsmanship, and the holistic development of students. The institute provides

top-notch sports facilities that not only nurture emerging talent but also

inspire a spirit of healthy competition among students.

At the heart of this vibrant

sporting environment lies the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Sports Complex a

state-of-the-art hub for athletic and recreational activities. This premier

sports facility serves as a cornerstone for promoting physical activities,

teamwork, and a sense of community, enriching campus life and fostering

all-round growth.

About National Institute of Technology Agartala The Government of India converted the Tripura Engineering College to National Institute of Technology Agartala on 1st April 2006 vide notification No. F. 20-20/2004/TS III/ dated 10.03.2006 of the Ministry of Human Resources Development (MHRD), Govt. of India. During the conversion, Tripura Engineering College was offering undergraduate degrees in Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication and Production Engineering.

Director’s Message The National Institute of Technology Agartala(NITA),an Institute of National Importance (INI) was instituted by Government of India with the mission to herald excellence in technical education and research in the North-East region. The institute was established by the Ministry of Education (MoE) in the era of renaissance in technical education in north east. PROF. S. K. PATRA Director, NIT Agartala

Life on Campus Our Students The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

Students Our Departments There are 9 (nine) branches in B. Tech. Level, 23 (twenty three) specializations in Engineering at Master’s Level and 4 branches in Dual Degree Level. The institute also offers MBA, MCA, M. Sc. and Doctoral Programs. The institute is also equipped with high-end laboratories that ensure an opportunity for the students to work independently.

Student’s Corner The Institute has Boys and Girls to accommodate in 4 Boys’ Hostels and 1 Girls’ Hostel. The Medical Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and other supporting staffs are available in the campus for rendering medical care. NIT Agartala has NCC unit for Boys and Girls. The NITA Student Gymkhana is an active student body that acts as a liaison between the students and the administration. The Gymkhana promotes the objectives of fostering extracurricular and co-curricular activities and welfare of the students. The students of NIT Agartala are also participated in the national level Technical Fest organized by different IITs and NITs. They are also actively engaged in different technical and cultural clubs. Training & Placement Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

About CRF-NIT, Agartala:-

The concept of Central Research Facility (CRF) is an integrated establishment to carry out research activities centrally under an umbrella. A CRF is of utmost importance in any academic institution where state-of-the-art analytical and high-end instruments are housed at a single location manned by qualified personnel to provide scientific and technical services for supporting research, carried out by UG, PG, PhD and project students. Such a facility represents a key commitment for preserving and raising the efficiency of research to top international standards. It strengthens the research-relevant infrastructure of Science and Technology.

At NIT Agartala, to begin with, CRF has been developed with various sophisticated equipment and instruments, mainly:

X-ray Diffractometer (XRD)

Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM)

Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM)

Liquid Nitrogen Plant (LNP)

Atomic Force Microscope (AFM)

All equipment and instruments under CRF will be used for various types of characterization including study of structure and chemical composition of surfaces and bulk materials at different length scales (sub-nanometer to millimeter), phase transitions, as well as evaluation of mechanical, electrical, magnetic, and optical properties. Liquid Nitrogen Plant (LNP) will help to produce Nitrogen in liquid form which can be utilized for developing low temperature research facility in the areas of Bio-Engineering, Chemistry and Medical Science.

Objectives of the CRF:-

Our objective is to extend the present research facilities to fulfill the following objectives:

to carry out analysis of samples received from the scientists/institutes;

to provide facilities of sophisticated analytical instruments to scientists and other users from academic institutes, R&D laboratories and industries to enable them to carry out measurements for R&D work;

to organize short term courses/workshops on the use and application of various instruments and analytical techniques;

to train technicians for maintenance and operation of sophisticated instruments; and

to carry out more effective and result oriented research of international level in the field of Science & Technology.

Users of the Facilities: -

All researchers from Academic Institutions and Industries.

Research Area :

Materials Science (Thin films & Nanoscience)

Molecular aggregates/nanostructures: Development of nanoscale molecular aggregates (J-aggregates/H-aggregate/excimer) and nanostructures (nanowires/nanorods) onto ultrathin films using LB/LbL technique that have potential applications toward optoelectronic devices and possess non linear optical activity.

Organic electronics: Development of switching memory devices using organic molecules and sensors using conducting polymers.

Organo-clay hybrid film: Development of hybrid films to stabilize organic films and control over molecular organization on the ultrathin films at nanoscale.

FRET based sensor: To identify different FRET pairs and apply them for sensor applications.

Bio Engineering

Program Outcomes (POs):

The students who have undergone the B.Tech. program in Bioengineering:

Will have an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science and basic engineering techniques in biological systems and will have comprehensive understanding of the working mechanisms of the biological systems and about the recent advancements in the field.

Will have an ability to analyze problems involving biological systems by using the principles of science, engineering and mathematics.

Will be able to provide solutions to the problems involving bioengineering by designing and conducting experiments, interpreting and analyzing data to find out trends.

Will have the knowledge and exposure on different laboratory techniques to analyze the biological systems, about different biomedical/process equipment and will have exposure to computational tools and approaches to solve problem involving biological systems.

Will gain expertise in handling modern equipment as well as computational tools which can be used in prediction and analysis of complex problems in bioengineering.

Will be able to apply knowledge acquired to assess health-related, legal and cultural issues and to serve the cause of medical sectors in the society.

Will be equipped with techniques to tackle pollution and will help achieving sustainable development.

Will learn about ethical issues related to developments biological sciences and bioengineering and will apply professional ethics in engineering practices.

will be able to function as a part of a team and individual, as the situation demands, to handles diverse problems in multi-disciplinary settings.

Will be able to communicate efficiently about the engineering problems related to bioengineering to the larger society with the aid of effective reports, documentation and presentation.

Will be able to utilize the knowledge of engineering and management principles to manage projects in multi-disciplinary set-up.

Will have the necessary impetus for life-long learning in the context of technological changes.

PEOs (Program Educational Objectives):

The major objectives of the B.Tech. program in Bioengineering are:

To impart knowledge about applications of engineering techniques in biological systems.

To attain knowledge and expertise to work efficiently in biotechnological, biochemical and biomedical industries .

To prepare students to pursue higher studies in bioengineering .

To develop capabilities to work in research and development organizations.

PSOs (Program Specific Objectives):

To learn protocols and employ engineering principles to solve the problems relevant to today’s industries in the field of bioengineering.

To learn to design and develop different equipment, experiments and computational approaches related to bioengineering.

Programmes :

The department currently offers the following programs:

Under Graduate Program (B.Tech) in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering for 4 Years

Post Graduate Program (M.Tech) in Biotechnology & Biochemical Engineering for 2 Years

PhD in Bio Engineering

i. Outline About the Department

The Department of Mathematics starts along with the inception of NIT

Agartala in 2006 with the up gradation of erstwhile Tripura Engineering

College (TEC).TEC had been a revered Institute in the field of

Engineering and Technology since its inceptions in 1965. The Institute

(TEC &NIT Agartala) has already completed its glorious fifty years

of its journey, in 2014. The Department of Mathematics is motivated

towards excellence in research and teaching and has accomplished in this

venture continuously over the time to a large extent. Initially, the

department catered the need of teaching Engineering Mathematics to the

undergraduate students. In 2010 the Department made a big stride in the

way of starting its M.Sc. in Mathematics program. Further expansion of

the Department in the form of opening BSMS, a 5 years dual degree course

in 2014 was really a milestone in the history of the Department. Since

then, it started functioning as a full-fledged department in true sense.

At present, the Department is offering M.Sc course in Mathematics and

Computing; BSMS (5 years dual degree course) in Mathematics and BSMS (5

years dual degree course) in Mathematics and Computing; Ph.D. Programs

in Mathematics (Pure & Applied) apart from helping the Engineering

and Management Departments in the way of offering Engineering

Mathematics, Operations Research(OR), Numerical Analysis to under

graduate and post graduate engineering students.

About the Faculty Members

The Department has highly qualified faculty members consisting of one

(1) Professor, four (4) Associate Professors, ten (10) Assistant

Professors, one (1) Teaching Assistant and one (1) Lab Assistant. In

their pursuit of research the faculty members are doing an extensive

study in  vast and diverse fields relating to Topological Space,

Nature-inspired Optimization Techniques, Inventory management

(Operations Research), De-Novo Programming Problem, Multi-Criteria

Decision-Making, Fuzzy Control System, Computational Fluid Dynamics,

Biomathematics, Graph theory, ODE & PDE , Super-symmetric Quantum

Mechanics, Water Wave Mechanics, Heat Transfer, Convection, Numerical

Methods, Neural Network, Wireless Network, Image Processing etc.

A Brief Insight

Energetic, highly motivated and academically sound young faculties and research scholars.

Dynamic involvement in academic and administrative tasks.

Contributing towards research on contemporary subject areas.

Authored books, book chapters and published their research works as patents.

Very frequently all faculties of our Department visit various

venerated  universities/Institutes in India and abroad in order to

present their research papers in conferences and to attend in Workshops ,

Schools and for doing collaborative research works.

In academic year 2019-20 total 96(approx) research papers have been published in reputed national and

international peer-reviewed journals with high impact factor.

About the Courses

Admission in the two years (4 Semester) M.Sc Degree Course is made

through merit basis with an initial intake capacity of 10 students.

Syllabus revision workshop was organized by the Department, for

up-gradation of UG-syllabus and course structure / syllabus for M.Sc.

program to make a significant contribution to academia and research

& development in Mathematics.

The Department offers two years (4 Semester) PG course, viz. M.Sc in

Mathematics and Computing with an initial intake capacity of 13

students. A syllabus revision workshop was organized by the Department,

for up-gradation of syllabus for this PG level program.

The Department also offers a 10 semester BS-MS Dual Degree Program in

Mathematics and Computing with initial intake capacity of 25 students.

This Dual Degree Program encourages and persuades the students to

grasp in-depth knowledge and also widens their career opportunities. On

completion of higher degree from this institute, a few of students

qualify for

some competitive exams  like NET, GATE, SET, TOEFL, GRE etc. in every

year for which our faculty members devote themselves in imparting

special coaching to students who aspire to qualify the exams. Some

fellows join Ph.D. career as full time researchers at reputed

universities or Institutes in India and abroad.

The Department offers collaborative and interdisciplinary Ph.D. programs

in Mathematics admitting both full time and part time research

scholars.

Program Educational Objective Statements

PEO-1:

To provide conducive environment for the students, Faculty members and staff to  develop the best teaching learning process.

PEO-2:

T

o develop state of the art Laboratories and Research facilities to cater the challenges in Electrical Engineering to come.

PEO-3:

To encourage innovation and professionalism so that social requirements of rural India may be fulfilled either by indigenous solution or through transfer of knowledge.

PEO-4:

o start collaborative Research with Industries and to cater the future requirements.

PEO-5:

To develop continuous improvement in teaching-learning process to develop state of the art laboratories to cater the present as well as future challenges in terms of local & global standard. Short term and long term goals are set for fulfillment of this mission.

PEO-6:

To develop right attitude and high aptitude so that individual may excel in the Competitive world maintaining high values and ethics.

Under Graduate Programmes

B.Tech in Electrical Engineering (4 Years):

This course aims at providing all the facilities

for producing technocrats with sound knowledge in all the subjects such as

electrical machines, power systems, instrumentation etc. including the elective

papers with a strong background of practical knowledge relevant to the theory

papers. Graduates coming out will be able to orient themselves to take up any

challenging jobs in the industry and also will be able to carry out research

and developmental activities with innovative ideas. The students are assigned

with a major project during the end semesters where they carry out the

developmental work under the guidance /supervision of the staffs.

Post Graduate Programmes

degree in following branches. It aims at providing all the facilities for

training graduate engineers in the field of Power Electronics & Drives,

Power System Engineering and Instrumentation Engineering; so that the students

will be confident enough to undertake responsibility, research &

consultancy work in their respective field. The students are assigned with a

major project during the 3rd & 4th semesters where they carry out the

developmental work under the guidance /supervision of the staffs to strengthen

their knowledge in that respective field of work.

programmes

Program Educational Objectives (PEOs)

PEO-1: To empower

students to identify, formulate and solve Mechanical Engineering

problems  by applying their knowledge in the field of Mathematics,

Science, Communication and Computing skills and enabling them to

understand specific problem areas and finding the optimum solutions for

the same.

PEO-2: To widen the talents of the students to become effective

collaborators and innovators, leading in efforts to tackle social,

business, design and production challenges.

PEO-3: To develop industry focused skills and leadership qualities to become successful engineers and entrepreneurs.

PEO-4: To enable students to acquire skills to communicate

effectively with the society and the constituents which enable them to

collaborate as team members and team leaders.

PEO-5: To instill professional work ethics and social responsibilities.

PEO-6: To encourage the students for developing life-long learning

attitude with moral ethics and values and professional development

through higher study, continuing education and Independent research

activities.

Chemical Engineering

programmes

With that

mission, the department started to offer BTech in Chemical Engineering degree

in the undergraduate level since 2009-10 and presently has an intake capacity

of 75 students. BTech is national JEE mains exams. In the postgraduate level,

the department is offering MTech in Chemical Engineering with intake capacity

of 10 seats since 2012-13. MTech positions are filled up both through GATE and

Non-GATE entrances. The department is also offering PhD in Engineering program

since 2012-13. The Ph.D. positions are filled-up twice a year through

advertisement and open completion.

The BTech

curriculum has 160 credits spanning over 4 years including 43 credits common

engineering curriculum in 1

st

year, 41.5 credits in 2

nd

year, 45 credits in 3

rd

year and 31.5 credits in 4

th

and

final year with options to undertake 6 months’ project in the industry in the

final semester of the BTech program.

The MTech

curriculum has 80 credits spanning over 2 years including 50 credit in 1

st

year, 30 credits in 2

nd

year, with options to undertake full 1 year

(2 semester) research in the final year of the MTech program

For the purpose

of delivering quality education to the students and keep upto changing global

and industrial demand, the department revises the curriculum from time to time

with input from industry and academia. The faculty members are involved in

teaching and advising students and make their academic journey memorable.

PROGRAM EDUCATION OBJECTIVES (PEOs)

PEO1-To impart the adequate fundamental knowledge in the chemical engineering domain.

PEO2- Application of chemical engineering knowledge in design, research, innovation, industrial practices and societal development.

PEO3- To impart adequate knowledge for the product development utilizing the available resources in the North-east part of the India.

PEO4- To enhance the skill of problem solving and employability, time and trace management, engagement in team work.

PROGRAM SPECIFIC OUTCOMES (PSOs)

PSO1- The graduated students will be employable to chemical and other allied industries by acquiring the knowledge to identify, analyze, control and solve the industrial, environmental and management problems.

PSO2-The students will be able to carry forward higher studies and research on multi-disciplinary fields.

PSO3-The students will be able to design chemical equipments, plants; development of products and also to carry out entrepreneurship.

facility

The department

has state-of the-art laboratories for teaching and research to cater emerging

research challenges. With the purpose of providing excellent learning and

research experience the department has developed elaborate laboratory

facilities. Facilities and infrastructure are added and revamped every year.

commonly found in many chemical industries.

Departmental Library:

In addition to Central library of the institute, the library of the department has

broad and eclectic collection of books, research articles covers different

aspects of chemical engineering to assist the students in order to enrich their

knowledge and ideas. Presently library owns several text books, reference

books, research articles as hard and soft copy.

cheresearch

engineering, environmental engineering, biofuel, bioenergy, renewable energy,

nanotechnology, and polymer technology, as well as many other emerging and

pressing areas of chemical engineering.

MBA

Master in Business Administration (MBA)

About the Programme

This programme is aimed at providing in–depth understanding to students in technical, human and conceptual skills necessary for a successful manager with specialization in different functional areas like Financial Management, Marketing Management, Human Resource and System Management. The teaching strategy for this programme oriented towards the application of knowledge with live cases and teaching aids. There is a six weeks summer internship programme for students, after completion of first year course to develop business acumen. The student has regular interactions with personalities from various Industries/ Academia and also undergoes frequent Industrial visits.

MBA Admission Process

Eligibility Criteria

:

Graduates of full time regular course in Engineering discipline with 60% of marks (CGPA/CPI of 6.0 in 10 point scale] and for any other disciplines with 55% of marks [CGPA/CPI of 5.5 in 10 point scale] with a valid CAT/CMAT/GMAT/MAT/Institute level test score. A relaxation of 5% or 0.5 in CGPA/CPI in a 10 point scale on graduation marks maybe extended to the SC/ST candidate.

Final year appearing candidates may also apply.

A valid GMAT score will be applicable for foreign students only

.

Students appearing at their final year graduation examination may also apply

(with eligibility criteria up to last completed semester) Such candidates, if selected, will be admitted provisionally and candidates have to submit certificate of completion of the graduation degree. If they are not able to fulfill the eligibility criteria or unable to submit certificate of completion of the graduation degree, their admission will be stand cancelled.

Application Fee (Non-refundable):

Rs. 1000/- for OP/OBC candidates and Rs. 500 for SC and ST candidates

Selection Process:

The steps involved in MBA Admission are as follows Step 1: Screening of applications on the basis of performance in entrance (CAT/CMAT/GMAT/MAT examination/ Institute Level Test) Step 2: Performance in Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI) Step 3: Profile of the Candidate

Programme Education Objectives:

The Programme has following education objectives:

Programme Objective- I:

Integrate functional areas of business knowledge across disciplines and synthesize functional business knowledge within strategic organizational framework.

Programme Objective- II:

Illustrate ability to apply critical thinking and ethical decision making to complex business problems and exhibit competence in applying interpersonal and managerial skills within an institutional context.

Programme Objective- III:

Demonstrate ability to motivate others to achieve strategic outcomes and create an orientation of personal responsibility, respect and professionalism.

Programme Outcomes:

The Programme has following education objectives:

a) Use systems thinking to describe how core concepts in each functional area relate to and are integrated across disciplines.

b) Identify appropriate processes for making organizational decisions.

c) Demonstrate ability to bring disparate functional areas of business to bear on the formulation of organizational strategy.

d) Identify and describe core concepts in the key functional areas of business.

e) Recognize and explain appropriate analytical methods for solving discipline--- specific business issues.

f) Construct a reasoned critique of an organizational decision.

g) Apply critical thinking skills in making an organizational decision.

h) Relate relevant ethical frameworks to the resolution of a business dilemma.

i) Display proficiency in building a persuasive case.

j) Show ability to manage organizational constituencies.

Management, Humanities & Social Sciences

PhD Ph.D. Programme The Department offers Ph.D programme (Full Time / Part Time / Self Sponsored) in Humanities & Social Sciences and Management . The admission to the Ph.D programme is conducted twice (as it is notified time to time basis) every year usually in the month of December/June. • Eligibility criteria for admission to Ph.D Programme in Humanities & Social Sciences : Scholars for admission to the Ph.D. program in Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS) must have a Master degree in relevant discipline with a minimum of 60% marks or equivalent or 6.5 CGPA in a 10 point grading system or 55% (6.0 CGPA out of 10) with a UGC/CSIR-NET/NBHM tenable for the year of admission. Preference will be given to NET qualified candidates. • Eligibility criteria for admission to Ph.D Programme in Management MBA/P.G. Diploma in Management of 2-year duration with 60% marks (or a CGPA of 6.5 in 10 point scale). Preference will be given to GATE and NET qualified candidates.

Department of Civil Engineering Civil Engineering Department is well equipped with the following laboratories. The laboratories are exclusively used for the routine laboratory classes of the students, routine testing, consultancy, research and developmental works for the external clients. Soil Mechanics Laboratory Structural Engineering Laboratory Transportation Engineering Laboratory Environmental Engineering Laboratory Solid Mechanics Laboratory Surveying Laboratory Engineering Geology Laboratory Civil Engineering Computer Laboratory Water Resources Engineering Laboratory Hydro-Informatics Engineering Laboratory Seismic Science and Engineering Laboratory These laboratories are well equipped with many sophisticated instruments like Non-destructive testing instruments, UTM, UV Spectro Photometer, Tilting Channel, Benkelman Beam, Bump Integrator, Digital Marshal, Total Station, Hand GPS, load pad etc and Soft computing tools like GIS, MX Road, STAAD Pro, Ansys, Auto CAD etc. which support the classes of the students, different research and consultancy activities of the department.The Department is having a departmental library. About

The Government of India converted the Tripura Engineering College to National Institute

of Technology Agartala on 1st April 2006 vide notification No. F. 20-20/2004/TS III/ dated

10.03.2006 of the Ministry of Human Resources Development (MHRD), Govt. of India. During

the conversion, Tripura Engineering College was offering undergraduate degrees in Civil,

Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication and Production Engineering.

Director’s Message

The National Institute of Technology Agartala(NITA),an Institute of National Importance (INI) was instituted by Government of India with the mission to herald excellence in technical education and research in the North-East region.

The institute was established by the Ministry of Education (MoE) in the era of renaissance in technical education in north east.

Life on Campus

Our Students

The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the

National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got

direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

Our Departments

There are 9 (nine) branches in B. Tech. Level, 23 (twenty three) specializations in Engineering at Master’s Level and 4

branches in Dual Degree Level. The institute also offers MBA, MCA, M. Sc. and Doctoral Programs. The institute is also equipped with high-end laboratories

Student’s Corner

The Institute has Boys and Girls to accommodate in 4 Boys’ Hostels and 1 Girls’ Hostel.

The Medical Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and other supporting staffs are available in the campus for

rendering medical care.

NIT Agartala has NCC unit for Boys and Girls.

The NITA Student Gymkhana is an active student body that acts as a liaison between the students and the administration. The Gymkhana promotes

the objectives of fostering extracurricular and co-curricular activities and welfare of the students.

The students of NIT Agartala are also participated in the national level Technical Fest organized by different IITs and NITs. They are also actively

engaged in different technical and cultural clubs.

Training & Placement

Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

Life on Campus

Our Students IThe word student is etymologically derived through Middle English from the Latin second-type conjugation verb studere, meaning "to direct one's zeal at"; hence a student could be described as "one who directs zeal at a subject". In its widest use, student is used for anyone who is learning. Even being in the remote Norh Eastern part of India, the students of NIT Agartala are not lagging behind in any of the activities.The students take active part in all sorts of activities held in cultural fests, in or outside the campus. The history of the college speaks of the students of NIT Agartala, their achievements in various events relating to science and technology and thier success in competitions being organized in various elite institues from various parts of thee country. The senior students feel their responsibility to help the junior students. It is very much true that the students and the faculty members help an institution to reach their persuing goal. This environment can be found in reality in this college. Needless to say, the effective and high quality feedback has been identified as a key element of quality teaching, and such arguments are well supported by the findings of meta-analysed studies that faculty members have coupled from their experiences and expertises with research on teams to create a number of resources that hopefully will help faculty members increase the effectiveness of students in their courses.

Computing & ICT Unit

The Computing & ICT Unit of NIT Agartala manages the network services, website and other domain related activity in the Institute.

Some major tasks being looked after by the Computing & ICT Unit are:

Providing the internet services to the Institute.

Providing the institute email services for employees and research students of the Institute.

Hosting and managing the Institute website.

Running all useful and essential services like naming services, DHCP services, firewall, web application services, etc to the institute for different purposes.

Providing the facility of Net based installation of major operating systems and other software to the Institute.

Providing the support to the technical team of the companies visiting for campus placement of students.

About NITA

About NITA

Our Vision

Institute is committed to develop highly competent young Engineers, Scientists, and Management Professionals to cater to the ever increasing techno-managerial needs of national and international standards fulfilling professional ethics and societal commitment.

Our Mission

To produce techno-managerial human resource in line with global need offering state-of-the-art facility, research and training in engineering and allied disciplines. To enhance the effectiveness of technical education with innovative system and devising a mechanism to facilitate application of research findings to solve real problems of industries/academics. To nurture and sustain an academic ambience conducive to the development of intellectually capable and committed professionals so that an effective growth is obtained for the economic development of the region and the nation as a whole. To establish as the corridor of higher education for the South East Asian countries.

Our Objective

In order to response effectively to the needs of the society, the Institute aims at Influencing the technical practices of the Governmental and Non-Governmental organizations through its Under Graduate and Post Graduate teaching programme for the young and prospective technocrats, Training of corporate executives, Consultancy and Research. The research programmes are oriented towards developing technical systems that are most suitable in the Indian context particularly for North-Eastern Zone. Transpiring the technical knowledge from the Institute level to the entrepreneurs, so that an effective growth is obtained for the economic development of the Region and the Nation as a whole. Enhance the effectiveness of technical education and innovative system and devising a mechanism to facilitate application of research findings to solve the problems in the industry.

Our Education System

Presently the Institute offers eight UG courses and PG courses in several fields along with Post Doctoral Fellowships. This Institute is autonomous under NIT being act passed by the parliament. The Institute recently introduced a new curriculum in the line of IITs where more number of elective subjects are being offered to make the system flexible. Previously, the Institute used to follow the mark based system of evaluation, but have been switching over to credit based system in order to keep track with the global evaluation methods. Industrial training, Undertaking projects are parts of the education system and students are also encouraged to take various activities for social development through NSS and NCC.

Facilities

The Institute is located in the midst of serene greenery having a picturesque natural beauty. It is about 4 km away from the National Highway and about 20 km from Agartala, the capital city of Tripura. Agartala is linked with the rest of the country by air, train and road. It has got direct Air Link with Kolkata, Delhi, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Guwahati and Imphal. The nearest railway station from the Institute campus is Jirania.

The Institute has all basic

infrastructural facilities. It has got adequate number of well qualified and experienced

faculty members and technical & supporting staff. This is a part the

Institute has the following facilities:-

Ø

Centralized Library (Knowledge Centre),

Ø

Computer Laboratory (Department-wise)

Ø

Workshops

Ø

Upgraded Laboratories with the latest equipments.

Ø

Campus Internet (Local Area Network and Wi-Fi)

Hostel Facilities:

The Institute has both Boys’ hostel and

Girls’ hostel facilities. Presently there are 5(five) Boys’ hostels with a

total intake capacity of 3000 and Girls’ hostels having intake capacity of 500.

Medical Care:

The Medical

Unit is well equipped with adequate Medical Officers including pharmacists and

other supporting staffs are available in the campus for rendering medical care

to the students, staff and other inmates in the campus. In case of emergency,

arrangements are made for shifting the patients to the Jirania Rural Hospital

(Primary Health Centre) which is 4km away from the campus. In case of grave

necessity, the patients are also taken to the State Hospital at Agartala.

Banks and Post Office

:  The

State Bank of India and Canara Bank has a branch with ATM facilities operating

from the Institute campus. Apart from this, the Punjab & Sindh Bank has

also an ATM facility in the Institute premises. The Tripura Gramin Bank runs

one branch in the Institute Complex. There is a Sub-Post Office in the name of

‘‘NIT, Agartala’’ in the Institute campus and its PIN Code is 799046.

Extra-Curricular

Activities

:  The students actively

participate in all co-curricular activities like games and sports, techno-cultural

festival, essay competition, drama competition, rallies on various themes, NSS

programmes etc. sponsored by the State Government, Central Government and other

statutory bodies and the Institute authority. N.S.S or N.C.C. is a compulsory

subject for all students of first year.

Center for Career Development (CCD)

Center for Career Development

Centre for Career Development (CCD) is to assist students in their career exploration and successful job search and to successive placement. The centre provides regular guidance to the students regarding their career ambitions. The aim and objective of the centre is to motivate student to adopt career oriented mindset in conjunction with job orientation. The centre facilitates convenient interface for the companies to interact with students so that it is mutually beneficial for both the student mass and for industry and corporate sectors. Such programs could inspire and motivate young talent towards core engineering sectors in order to meet the demands of the corporate world staging a drive for national progress and to become diligent citizens.

Sports at NIT-Agartala

NIT Agartala is

renowned for its dynamic sports culture that emphasizes physical fitness,

sportsmanship, and the holistic development of students. The institute provides

top-notch sports facilities that not only nurture emerging talent but also

inspire a spirit of healthy competition among students.

At the heart of this vibrant

sporting environment lies the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Sports Complex a

state-of-the-art hub for athletic and recreational activities. This premier

sports facility serves as a cornerstone for promoting physical activities,

teamwork, and a sense of community, enriching campus life and fostering

all-round growth.

TEXMiN CoE Activities

Funding Opportunities for UG/PG students -Texmin COE NIT Agartala Mining Project Proposals

We are delighted to announce the formal establishment of a

Memorandum of Agreement (MoA)

for the

"TEXMiN–NIT Agartala Mining Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) Centre of Excellence (CoE)"

at

(Ref:

TEXMiN/NITA/COE/24-25/372

).

Under this initiative, a total budget of

₹120.00 Lakhs

for four years with yearly budget of

30.0 lakhs

has been sanctioned to support the development of

CPS-based solutions

aligned with the

TEXMiN mandate

, focusing on the following thrust areas:

Technology Development (TD)

Innovation & Entrepreneurship (IE)

This four-year collaboration aims to drive

transformative technological advancements

in the mining sector.

We are pleased to share the finalized formats for the following key components under the CoE:

Technology Development Projects

Pre-Incubation Support for Students

Undergraduate Fellowships

All documents have been prepared in accordance with

TEXMiN’s operational norms and guidelines

. For further details, please refer to the attached MoA.

To ensure transparency and adherence to best practices,

at least one representative from TEXMiN will be included in the selection process

.

Important Note:

The last date for submission of proposals under the above-mentioned schemes is

31st August 2025.
